datafield.subfield: Nucleon Structure and the Neutron Electric Dipole Moment from Twisted Mass Lattice QCD

Recent results on nucleon structure using twisted mass lattice QCD simulated with a quark mass yielding the physical pion mass are presented. Namely, the nucleon axial charges and moments of parton distribution functions are discussed as well as the implication of these results on the decomposition of the nucleon spin. Results on the electromagnetic structure are also presented, including a recent study of the neutron Electric Dipole Moment using simulations with pion mass of 370 MeV.
